intro: Phelipanche nowackiana, commonly known as the narrowleaf morning glory, is a flowering plant belonging to the Convolvulaceae family. It is a perennial herb characterized by its slender, climbing stems and heart-shaped leaves. The plant produces showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that are typically blue or purple in color. It thrives in temperate climates and is often found in disturbed soils. Due to its invasive nature, it can become a weed in agricultural settings.
